# {{mul-kangxi radical-def}}

subSections.title: Chinese
subSections.text: {{zh-forms}}

subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text: {{Han etym}}

subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
{{zh-ref|Norman and Mei (1976)}} propose that this was a substrate loan; cf. {{cog|mkh-vie-pro|*ŋaː||[[ivory]]}} ({{cog|vi|ngà}}), {{cog|tai-pro|*ŋaːᴬ||[[tusk]]; [[ivory]]}} ({{cog|th|งา}}). {{zh-ref|Pulleyblank (1983)}} disagrees with their hypothesis and considers Old Chinese to be the donor of this [[Wanderwort]] instead.

STEDT provisionally sets up {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*s-ŋja||tusk; tooth}}, comparing it to {{cog|lus|ngho||tusk; fang}}, {{cog|mni|tr=ya|t=tooth}}, {{cog|mro|tr=hngou|t=tooth}}, {{cog|blk|tr=tə́ʔ '''ŋà'''|t=tooth}}.

subSections.text:
{{zh-pron
|m=yá
|ma=y
|m-s=ya2
|dg=я1
|c=ngaa4
|h=pfs=ngà
|md=ngà/ngāi
|md_note=ngāi - [[synaeresis]] of {{zh-l|*牙齒}} used alone or in some compounds
|mn=xm,qz,tw:gê/zz:gêe/gâ
|mn_note=gê/gêe - vernacular (“tooth; fang; ivory; broker”); gâ - literary (“screw thread”)
|mn-t=ghê5
|w=3nga
|mc=y
|oc=y
|cat=n
}}

subSections.title: Descendants
Kanji
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanji|grade=|rs=牙00}}

# [[tusk]], [[fang]]

subSections.title: Readings
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|き}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=き}}. Appears in the ''[[w:Man'yōshū|Man'yōshū]]''.<ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|き}}

subSections.title: Noun
Usage notes
subSections.text: Although this term is no longer used in isolation, it does persist in certain compounds.

subSections.title: Derived terms
Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|きば}}
Compound of {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=きば}} elements {{compound|ja|sort=きば|牙|tr1=ki|t1=fang, tusk|歯|tr2=ha|t2=tooth}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> {{rendaku2|sort=きば|ha|ba}}

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|きば|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

subSections.title: Noun
Usage notes
subSections.text: This is the most common term for {{m|en|fang}} in modern Japanese.

subSections.title: Derived terms
Idioms
subSections.text:
{{der-top|Idioms}}
* {{ja-r|牙を噛む|きば を かむ}}: “to bite one's fangs” → to [[gnash]] one's [[teeth]]
* {{ja-r|牙を研ぐ|きば を とぐ}}: “to sharpen one's fangs” → to [[prepare]] to [[hurt]] one's [[opponent]]. Compare [[sharpen one's claws]]
* {{ja-r|牙を鳴らす|きば を ならす}}: “to clash one's fangs” → to [[gnash]] one's [[teeth]]; to get [[angry]]; to [[bare]] one's [[fang]]s
* {{ja-r|牙を剥く|きば を むく}}: “to bare one's fangs”
* {{ja-r|牙あるものは角無し|きば ある もの は つの なし}}: “the one with fangs has no horns” → a [[metaphor]] for how no one is [[endow]]ed with every [[advantage]]
{{der-bottom}}

subSections.title: See also
subSections.text:
* {{ja-r|門歯|もんし}}: [[incisor]] tooth
* {{ja-r|犬歯|けんし}}: [[canine tooth]]
* {{ja-r|小臼歯|しょうきゅうし}}: [[premolar]]
* {{ja-r|臼歯|きゅうし}}: [[molar]]
* {{ja-r|象牙|ぞうげ}}: [[elephant]] [[tusk]], [[ivory]]

subSections.title: Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|かび}}
Cognate with, and probably the noun derivation of, verb {{m|ja|黴びる|tr=kabiru||to go moldy}}, from the root idea of something [[sprout]]ing.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> Used in the ''[[w:Kojiki|Kojiki]]''.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|かび}}

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|かび}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=かび|obsolete}} a plant [[sprout]], a plant [[bud]]

subSections.title: Derived terms
subSections.text: * {{ja-r|葦牙|あしかび}}: a [[reed]] [[sprout]] or [[bud]]

subSections.title: Etymology 4
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|は}}
Non-standard alternate spelling for {{m|ja|歯|tr=ha||tooth}}.<ref name="KDJ"/>

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|は}}

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|は}}

# {{alternative spelling of|lang=ja|sort=は|歯||[[tooth]]}}

subSections.title: Etymology 5
Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=goon|げ}}

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|げ}}

# an [[animal]]'s [[fang]] or [[tusk]]
# an [[elephant]]'s [[tusk]]: [[ivory]]
# a [[tooth]]

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: The {{m|en|tooth}} meaning is much more commonly expressed using the word {{m|ja|歯|tr=ha}}.

subSections.title: Derived terms
subSections.text:
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|牙の笏|げ の しゃく}}: an [[ivory]] [[mace]] or [[scepter]], used by certain social classes in ancient Japan
* {{ja-r|牙%歯|げ%し}}: teeth, tusks, or fangs
* {{ja-r|牙%軸|げ%じく}}: the inner edge of a scroll around which the scroll is [[wound]], or an edge of a folding book to which pages are [[bound]], made of [[ivory]]
* {{ja-r|牙%床|げ%しょう|rom=-}}, {{ja-r|牙%象|げ%しょう}}: a kind of [[cutout]] [[decorative]] [[carving]] technique for [[panel]]s, wherein the corners are left intact to reinforce the structure of the panel
* {{ja-r|牙%彫|げ%ぼり}}: a [[carving]] made from a [[tusk]] or [[fang]], more specifically made of [[elephant]] [[ivory]]
* {{ja-r|牙%笏|げ%しゃく}}: an [[ivory]] [[mace]] or [[scepter]], used by certain social classes in ancient Japan
{{der-bottom}}

subSections.title: Etymology 6
Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=o|が}}

subSections.title: Affix
subSections.text:
{{ja-pos|affix|が}}

# an [[animal]]'s [[fang]] or [[tusk]]
# an [[elephant]]'s [[tusk]]: [[ivory]]
# a [[tooth]]

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: The ''ga'' reading is only used in compounds, and is never used in isolation.

subSections.title: Derived terms
subSections.text:
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|牙営|がえい}}: the [[headquarters]] of a general in a field camp
* {{ja-r|牙音|がおん}}: a [[velar consonant]] {{qualifier|obsolete}}
* {{ja-r|牙関 緊急|がかん きんきゅう}}: [[lockjaw]], a common [[symptom]] in the early stages of [[tetanus]]
* {{ja-r|牙旗|がき}}: a [[flag]] raised at the site of an [[emperor]]'s or [[general]]'s field camp
* {{ja-r|牙行|がこう}}: in China, a [[middleman]] or [[go-between]] in a [[commercial]] [[transaction]]
* {{ja-r|牙山|^がざん}}: the city of [[w:Asan|Asan]], a [[port]] in [[w:South Korea|South Korea]]
* {{ja-r|牙商|がしょう}}: a [[middleman]] or [[go-between]] in a [[commercial]] [[transaction]]
* {{ja-r|牙城|がじょう}}: the [[keep]] or main [[residence]] within a [[castle]]; a [[headquarters]], a [[base]], a [[stronghold]]
* {{ja-r|牙人|がじん}}: in China, a [[middleman]] or [[go-between]] in a [[commercial]] [[transaction]]
* {{ja-r|牙銭|がせん}}: a [[fee]] or [[commission]] charged by a {{ja-r|牙行|がこう}}
* {{ja-r|牙%虫|が%むし}}: a [[water scavenger beetle]] of [[family]] {{taxlink|Hydrophilidae|family|noshow=1}}
* {{ja-r|牙斧|がふ}}: a small [[axe]] or [[hatchet]] made from [[boar]] [[tusk]]
* {{ja-r|牙保|がほ}}: a [[middleman]] or [[go-between]] in a [[commercial]] [[transaction]]
* {{ja-r|牙保%罪|がほ%ざい}}: the [[crime]] of [[fencing]] goods known to be [[stolen]]
* {{ja-r|牙保%犯|がほ%はん}}: the [[crime]] of [[fencing]] goods known to be [[stolen]]
* {{ja-r|牙門|がもん}}: a [[gate]] on which a [[general]]'s [[flag]] is flying; an army's [[headquarters]]
* {{ja-r|牙籌|がちゅう}}: an [[abacus]]; more specifically, an [[ivory]] abacus
* {{ja-r|牙籤|がせん|rom=-}}, {{ja-r|牙籖|がせん}}: a small [[placard]] or [[label]] made of [[ivory]]; a small [[claw]]-shaped ivory [[clasp]] for holding a [[book]] closed
* {{ja-r|牙纛|がとう}}: the [[flag]] of a [[general]]'s [[army]], the [[pole]] of which was traditionally decorated with [[ivory]] on the end
* {{ja-r|牙%儈|が%かい}}: in China, a [[middleman]] or [[go-between]] in a [[commercial]] [[transaction]]
{{der-bottom}}
